meanings.sent1: Her insecurenesses made it hard for her to speak up in class.
meanings.sent2: His insecurenesses were evident when he avoided eye contact.
meanings.sent3: Despite her insecurenesses, she bravely volunteered to lead the team.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds of insecurenesses loomed over his mind, casting doubt on his abilities.
meanings.sent5: The weight of her insecurenesses felt heavy on her chest, suffocating her self-esteem.

meanings.definition: State of being uncertain or vulnerable.
meanings.sent1: The insecurenesses of the situation left them feeling anxious.
meanings.sent2: In times of change, our insecurenesses can be heightened.
meanings.sent3: The cat's insecurenesses about the new dog in the house were quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The fragile bridge symbolized the insecurenesses of their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The insecurenesses of the old house were evident in the creaking floors and drafty windows.
